Title: Military Health System GENESIS Training
Subject: The MHS is transitioning to MHS GENESIS, the DOD’s modernized Electronic Health Record (EHR) system, to provide enhanced, secure technology to manage health information. While enterprise solution standards control the MHS GENESIS design across the entire MHS and are not specific to one site, the individual components are responsible for ensuring proposed MHS GENESIS end users are properly trained prior to being granted access to the EHR system.

Title: Anatomic Gifts and Tissue Donation
Subject: Establishes the Defense Health Agency's procedures for organ and tissue donation. This applies to the donation of human organs and tissues, for transplantation, therapy, research, or education, pursuant to Section 1109(b) of Reference (1).

Title: Pain Management and Opioid Safety in Military Medical Treatment Facilities
Subject: Establishes the VA-DOD Stepped Care Model (SCM) for Pain Management as the comprehensive standardized pain management model for the DHA to provide consistent, quality, and safe care for patients with pain with an emphasis on multidisciplinary, multi-modal, and nonpharmacologic pain management

Title: Walk-in Contraception Services at Military Medical Treatment Facilities
Subject: Establishes the Defense Health Agency’s (DHA) procedures for implementation of walk-in contraception services at all Military Medical Treatment Facilities (MTF), for Active Duty members of the Armed Forces and for eligible beneficiaries of the Military Health System (MHS) on a space available basis.

Title: Telework Program and Remote Work
Subject: Implements Reference, assigns responsibilities, and prescribes procedures for implementing the DHA Telework Program and Remote Work.

Title: Mandatory Use of the Defense Medical Logistics Standard Support Facilities Management/LogiCole Facilities Management Systems
Subject: Establishes the DHA procedures for the mandatory use of the Defense Medical Logistics Standard Support-Facilities Management, and its technical replacement system known as LogiCole Facilities Management as the Computer-Aided Facilities Management and Computerized Maintenance Management System systems of record.

Title: Personnel Transferred or Assigned to the Defense Health Agency from the Military Departments
Subject: Supplement 1 to DHA-Policy Memorandum 22-009 directing Market Director/Service Component Commanders to consider the impact on MTF operations and health care delivery before assigning military members to required duties outside of the MTF.

Title: Privacy and Civil Liberties Compliance
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for achieving and managing compliance within the DHA for Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act policy development and guidance, and various privacy and civil liberties initiatives.

Title: Reliability Centered Maintenance Program
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for the implementation of a Reliability Centered Maintenance Program, including Condition Based Maintenance, for DHA sustained facilities.

Title: Incident Management Tool of Choice
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to standardize the use Defense Health Agency Global Service Center Incident Management Tools for centrally-managed automated information systems.

Title: Surgical and Procedural Patient Safety Practices
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to improve the quality and safety of medical care provided to beneficiaries by standardizing  various processes.

Title: Continued Service Agreement
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to implement the Government Employees Training Act.

Title: Facilities Enterprise Sustainment, Restoration, and Modernization
Subject: Establishes DHA's policy and procedures for the sustainment, restoration, modernization, and operation of facilities assigned to DHA.

Title: Fiscal Guidance for Facility Sustainment, Restoration, and Modernization Funding Activities
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to guide DHA Operation & Maintenance Facility Sustainment, Restoration, and Modernization funds management and funds flow articulates stakeholder roles, responsibilities, and functions as delineated within the DHA’s centralized process for executing FSRM.

Title: Pandemic Stockpile Management
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to manage Pandemic Stockpiles, inventory management, and the accountability of stockpiles stored at military hospitals and clinics.

Title: Merit Promotion and Placement Plan
Subject: Establishes DHA's policies, responsibilities, and procedures for the selection of employees covered by merit promotion and in-service placement.

Title: Operational Medical Materiel Analysis Program
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for providing analytical support to the MILDEP in the management of operational assemblages.

Title: Mandatory Use of Defense Health Agency Enterprise (Off-Site) Teleradiology Services Contract by Military Medical Treatment Facilities
Subject: To instruct MTFs on the mandatory use of the DHA Enterprise Teleradiology Services Indefinite Delivery-Indefinite Quantity contract.

Title: Defense Health Agency Time-to-Hire
Subject: Establishes time-to-hire procedures within the DHA.

Title: Birth Certificate and Birth Reporting Procedures
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for birth certificate and reporting at military medical treatment facilities.

Title: Standardized Leadership Board Requirements for all Defense Health Agency Aligned Facilities
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for Chain of Leadership Board requirements across the DHA enterprise to increase awareness of the DHA leadership structure and ensure standardization.

Title: Acquisition Authorities and Implementation of the Defense Acquisition System
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to implement acquisition authorities.

Title: Education, Training, and Clinical Readiness Activities in the Military Health System
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to manage education, training, and clinical readiness activities across the MHS.

Title: Standard Form 182 Administration
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for the Administration of Standard Form (SF) 182, “Authorization, Agreement, and Certification of Training.”

Title: Delegation of Authority and Assignment of Responsibility for Administration and Management of Direct Care
Subject: Establishes DHA's delegations of authority and responsibility for the management of MTFs and DTFs transferred from Military Departments to control of the DHA.

Title: Competitive Programs
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for the Workforce Development Branch program directives.

Title: Defense Health Agency Cancer Registry Program
Subject: Creates DHA’s procedures to establish common and uniform guidelines, standards, and procedures for all DOD military medical treatment facilities providing oncological medical services to MHS beneficiaries.

Title: 180-Day Waiver Delegation Update
Subject: Delegates the authority to approve the appointment of retired members of the Armed Forces, within 180 days after retirement, to Market/Small and Market Stand-alone Organizations/Defense Health Agency Regions Directors.

Title: Authorized Nonlethal Weapons and Devices for Defense Health Agency Security Guards
Subject: Identifies all approved nonlethal weapons and devices authorized for use by DHA security guards.

Title: Walk-in Contraception Services at Military Medical Treatment Facilities
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for implementation of walk-in contraception services at all Military Medical Treatment Facilities for Active Duty and eligible beneficiaries of the MHS.

Title: Defense Medical Logistics Standard Support–Volume 9, Financial Procedures
Subject: Establishes DHA's instructions for using the Defense Medical Logistics Standard Support application.

Title: The Care and Use of Animals in DOD Research, Development, Test, and Evaluation (RDT&E) or Training Programs
Subject: Establishes the procedures to set forth the policies for care and use of animals used in Research, Development, Test, and Evaluation that is conducted at any location by DOD programs.

Title: Antiterrorism Program
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to update responsibilities and provide direction for the implementation and establishment of the DHA Antiterrorism Program.

Title: Controlled Medical Items Management for Medical Logistics Areas
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to provide policy and procedures necessary for managing controlled medical items within DHA's Medical Logistics departments.

Title: Lifecycle Management Services Information Technology Asset Management
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for implementing and managing Information Technology.

Title: Sustainment Management System (SMS) BUILDER Site Support for Real Property Assets
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for collecting and managing data in the DHA SMS-BUILDER database.

Title: Consolidated Department of Defense Coronavirus Disease 2019 Force Health Protection Guidance
Subject: Provides supplemental, ongoing guidance in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Personnel Transferred or Assigned to the Defense Health Agency from the Military Departments
Subject: Provides guidance on the use of military members assigned to the DHA and civilian employees who have been transferred to DHA from a Military Department.

Title: Suicide Risk Care Pathway for Adult Patients in the Defense Health Agency
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to screen and comprehensively assess patients in the DHA for suicide risk.

Title: Permanent Change of Station for Civilian Employees
Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for payment of travel, transportation, and relocation expenses for new appointees and employees transferred in the interest of the Government.

Title: Clinical Investigation Program in Military Medical Treatment Facilities
Subject: Establishes procedures for the funding and administration of the CIP within DOD MTFs.

Title: Photography, Videotaping, Filming, Recording, and Imaging of Patients, Visitors, and Staff
Subject: Establishes DHA's policies concerning the production of still images, videos, and audio recordings of patients, visitors, and staff..

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for managing data in the MHS Computer Aided Facility Management/Computerized Maintenance Management System of record.

Subject: Provides medical logistics personnel and other DMLSS users with the technical guidance procedures to carry out the medical logistics support mission.

Subject: Establishes the DHA Medical Logistics Joint Operations Center.

Title: Pay Setting Policy
Subject: Establishes DHA civilian personnel policies and procedures for pay setting determinations in instances where law, regulation, or other policy permits discretion.

Title: Incentives to Attract and Retain Civilian Employees
Subject: Establishes procedures to assign responsibilities and establishes procedures for the DHA’s recruitment, retention, and relocation incentives that may be used to attract and retain top-quality civilian employees.

Title: Clinical Quality Management in the Military Health System
Subject: Ensures an orderly and seamless transition of the administration and management of military hospitals and clinics from the Military Departments to the DHA.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to implement instructions, assign responsibilities, and prescribe procedures for the DOD’s COVID-19 Vaccination Program.

Subject: Provides supplemental guidance on facility-related issues that support, and will be coordinated within, the DHA’s procedures for the accreditation and certification compliance management program.

Subject: Provides medical logistics personnel and other DMLSS users with the technical guidance procedures to carry out the medical logistics support mission.

Subject: Provides medical logistics personnel and other DMLSS users with the technical guidance procedures to carry out the medical logistics support mission.

Subject: Provides medical logistics personnel and other DMLSS users with the technical guidance procedures to carry out the medical logistics support mission.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to establish and operate Informatics Steering Committees.

Subject: Provides medical logistics personnel and other DMLSS users with the technical guidance procedures to carry out the medical logistics support mission.

Title: Research Subject Compensation
Subject: Establishes DHA's responsibilities, procedures, and guidance for the compensation of study subjects for their participation in human subject research within the DHA's research programs.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for the management of energy and water resources consumed at all DHA components.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to provide a direct channel of communication between the DHA MEDLOG Directorate, Direct Reporting Organization (DRO) MEDLOG accounts, DRO Directors, Direct Reporting Market Directors, and assist DHA MEDLOG accounts in executing the MEDLOG mission across the Enterprise.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to screen for depression and suicide risk in the Military Health System during and subsequent to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for identifying when, where, and what type of emergency power and/or standby generators are acceptable and appropriate for use within DHA-assigned facilities.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures to provide guidelines for the lifecycle management of the DOD Health Record.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for the clinical management of HIV-infected Service members.

Subject: Establishes DHA’s procedures to provide guidelines for the lifecycle management of the DOD Health Record.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for managing the Military Health System’s general equipment.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for managing PM data in the Military Health System’s DMLSS-FM.

Subject: Establishes DHA's standards for performance of routine adult TTE across military hospitals and clinics.

Subject: Provides guidance on the implementation of vaccination, attestation, and testing requirements to reduce the transmission of the virus that causes COVID-19.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for the Capital Investment Decision Model.

Subject: Procedures to establish guidance to provide medical readiness services, for RC Service members on duty other than active duty for a period of more than 30 days.

Subject: Establishes DHA’s process to manage MDE requirements for the DHA Medical Logistics Enterprise.

Subject: Establishes DHA’s procedures to assign responsibilities and establish procedures for managing Clinical Quality Management in the Military Health System.

Subject: Establishes DHA’s procedures to assign responsibilities and establish procedures for managing Clinical Quality Management in the Military Health System.

Subject: Establishes DHA’s procedures to assign responsibilities and establish procedures for managing Clinical Quality Management in the Military Health System.

Subject: Establishes DHA's procedures for nominations and selections for the Quarterly/Annual Military Service Member Recognition Program.

Subject: Provides detailed guidance related to performance management and appraisal of DHA civilian employees.
